newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares ease, further downside seen.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares ease, further downside seen.

text.p: Austrian shares tumbled on Monday in consolidation after a feisty rally last week and traders saw room for further downside, but at a slower pace than today.
"It all went a bit fast and we are still pretty high," said one trader.
Dealers predicted the index would trade within a 1,430-to-1,485-point range in the short term.
"It's just profit-taking," said another trader of the drop. "Of course there are rate concerns there too," she added.
Traders across Europe voiced concerns over rate hikes in the United States after strong economic data released on Friday prompted inflation worries.
The blue chip ATX dropped 19.35 points, or 1.32 percent, to 1,452.11. Among its constituents were 19 losers, one gainer, and one share remaining unchanged.
The session's top gainer was brickmaker Wienerberger, rising 1.56 percent to close at 2,705.5 schillings.
Steelmaker VA Stahl led the losers, down 6.32 percent at 569.55 schillings.
The August ATX future shed 19.60 points to 1,451.0. -- Vienna newsroom, +43-1 531 12 257
